The plant typically grows in shaded, moist forest environments, preferring well-drained soil. Its leaves are lanceolate and arranged in a basal rosette, while its flowers are borne on long pedicels. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
